intro: Cypella herbertii subsp. herbertii, commonly known as Herbert's cypella, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
